GDELT.Action2Geo_Fullname: Ohio Northern University, Ohio, United States

ARTICLE.TITLE: Biden, Sanders cancel Cleveland rallies over coronavirus concerns
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Fears over the COVID-19 coronovirus have led Democratic presidential candidates Bernie Sanders and Joe Biden to cancel planned Tuesday night rallies in Cleveland.

Vermont Senator Sanders had originally scheduled a 7:30 p.m. rally at the Huntington Convention Center.

Meanwhile, Biden’s campaign canceled a 9 p.m. appearance by the former vice president at the Cuyahoga Community College Recreation Center.

Ohio officials have said they are concerned about large, indoor events during the coronavirus outbreak.

Ohio officials on Monday said three people in Cuyahoga County have tested positive for the coronavirus.

Blain Dearth, a Ohio Northern University student from Ada, made the trek north for the Sanders rally before learning it was canceled.

"It's disappointing," Dearth said. "We can't blame him it's obvious a serious situation. We don't want Bernie getting sick or anything like that. He's 78."

Drew Mantenieks, a Ohio Northern University student from Westerville also showed up at the Sanders rally only to learn it was canceled.

"Yeah, it's like I understand," he said. " I want him to be president so if this is what precaution he has to take I'm not going to mad about it."
